header_summary: Tom Briar suggests a different approach to handling lock time in transactions, proposing to focus on grinding the block height instead of adding more fields. ZmnSCPxj expresses interest in Lightning as a non-blockchain mechanism for scaling blockchains, highlighting differences between mainstake and other sidechain proposals. Nick Farrow discusses a draft scheme for blinding and FROST compatibility in Bitcoin transactions. Bastien TEINTURIER proposes an architecture using a hardware security module to securely send administrative commands to a lightning node. David Stainton discusses a modification to Sphinx and the importance of the security-preserving KEM combiner in Noise. Atomic Mr Nuclear explains the permissioned nature of the Lightning channel and its advantages in protecting against Sybil attacks.

recent_posts.title: Compressed Bitcoin Transactions
recent_posts.summary:
- Currently, if a non-zero lock time is given, the system drops the 16 most significant bits and continues.
- Adding more fields to this process can significantly increase decompression time.
- Tom suggests dropping the grinding of the lock time and agreeing on a single block height instead to save space.

recent_posts.title: Sentinel Chains: A Novel Two-Way Peg
recent_posts.summary:
- The sender expresses initial interest in sidechains as a scaling solution for blockchains.
- Later, they turn their attention to Lightning as a non-blockchain mechanism for scaling blockchains.
- They suggest a federated sidechain among individuals for developing and prototyping new features.

recent_posts.title: Private Collaborative Custody with FROST
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses a draft scheme that explains blinding and FROST compatibility.
- The scheme involves obtaining a public nonce and constructing an aggregate FROST nonce for signing.
- Security assessment is recommended due to the exclusion of the binding factor in the custodian's nonce.

recent_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
recent_posts.summary:
- Bastien has submitted a pull request to bLIPs repository documenting a secure command-sending architecture.
- The architecture involves using a hardware security module as a lightning peer with minimal changes.
- Bastien proposes contributing specifications and reviewing the implementation under an open-source grant.

recent_posts.title: faster NIKE Sphinx or more secure KEM Sphinx
recent_posts.summary:
- David suggests naming the modified Sphinx as "PQ Sphinx" or "KEM Sphinx".
- He mentions the existence of PQ Noise that uses KEMs and references its implementation.
- David highlights the benefits of upgrading protocols to use PQ cryptography and suggests modifying the Snow Rust implementation.

recent_posts.title: Nucleus: Capital-efficient multipeer Lightning payment channels
recent_posts.summary:
- In the email, the sender explains that the Bitcoin blockchain is permissionless, but not the Lightning channel.
- The Lightning channel requires authorization from all participants, providing protection against Sybil attacks.
- The permissioned nature of the Lightning channel offers security advantages compared to the Bitcoin blockchain.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- We are implementing 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains, with server fully 'blinded'.
- Security relies on trusting statechain server to report partial signatures generated for a key.
- The musig2 protocol involves key and nonce generation, challenge computation, and final signature.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- Ark, a new second-layer protocol design, offers an alternative approach to the Lightning network.
- Users can send and receive funds without liquidity constraints using virtual UTXOs (vTXOs).
- Improved anonymity and off-chain payments are facilitated through the intermediary Ark Service Provider (ASP).

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- The growth potential of blockchain storage is significant, with an estimated 210.24GB per year.
- Despite the potential growth, a 5TB hard drive costing less than $150 can last 21 years.
- Ongoing optimization efforts, like Floresta, can reduce the space required by individual nodes.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new method for resumable lightning channels from a wallet seed.
- It addresses channel backup issues and the inability to resume operations with static backups.
- The proposal includes the use of fraud proofs, asymmetric roles, and bandwidth-saving measures.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard proposes to organize the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- He emphasizes the need for transparency and invites feedback on his involvement in organizing the summit.
- Antoine suggests surveying countries like Algeria, Ghana, Senegal, and Nigeria for hosting the summit.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We will conduct a "dry run" to validate local reputation algorithms and gather data.
- Anonymized forwarding data will be collected in a CSV file format for analysis.
- Experimental TLV called "endorsement" will be propagated to set the value of HTLC endorsement.
